Summary: Object approach ocean, changed color as it hovered, then changed color again and shot off at very high speed
divs: sighting details on friday, august 4, 2006, at approximately 11:30 pm, i was driving west along ocean boulevard in long beach, ca. ocean boulevard runs in an east-west direction along the shore of the pacific ocean, as the city is a south-facing beach, situated in a small notch in the southern ca coastline. i stopped my car and parked on lindero avenue and crossed ocean boulevard to bluff park, a railed off cliff that overlooks the ocean. i enjoy watching the ocean, the oil islands and this area, which is three blocks from my home. off to my right (west), i noticed a white light approaching from the san pedro\los angeles ports. at that distance, it looked like a helicopter shining its searchlight straight ahead. while i had never seen a helicopter flying that high, it was the only thing that came to mind. the light moved at the speed of a small plane, descending rapidly from very high up to almost ocean level as it approached an area maybe 1.5 miles offshore. i feared it was indeed a small plane or helicopter crashing into the ocean. instead, at a height i estimate as between 15 to 25 feet (difficult to tell at that distance and at night), the object stopped! it just stopped on a dime! i then realized this was something different. the object then turned a blue color and hovered in place for what seemed like 20 to 30 seconds. no spotlight as such came from it, though it did illuminate the area underneath it with its blue glow. the area it hovered over was beyond the small oil refinery island and breakwater, which would put it about a mile and a half from shore. i estimate it was about 12 feet high by 20 feet long, but i realize the distance and dark make that just a best guess. while hovering, it also rotated and each side had a row of solid (not blinking) blue light. it is more accurate to say that it appeared to me to be rotating, since the strip of light would blink off for a second and then reappear, creating the impression that it was rotating. after about a half-minute, it rose very slightly [maybe five or six feet?], and tilted so that i could see its underside and shape better. the light from it went from blue to white again, and the outline was definitely triangular, with (perhaps) a small concave area along the "back." after it tilted, its color went from white to orange-red, and it literally zipped off south, towards catalina island [and past it, i imagine], as it rose steadily and at a steep angle. i am not great at estimating speed, but it seemed like it went from a mile and a half away to way out and far out in a split second. i have never seen anything go that fast, except for perhaps a shooting star. it was amazingly fast. and that was it. other than it quick stop and quick take off speed, it never made any sharp angular turns that i saw or anything like that. from the time i first saw it to the time it was gone, it had followed a very wide, open v-path: from high in the west to the water surface and then back on high to the south. with time, this incident has caused me a mixture of anxiety, depression and an odd elation. i really want to know what this was, but i know i never will. i have taken to going to the shore at night with binoculars and my digital camera--it has become an embarassing obsession.
